data.title: Yala city mayor pushes flood prevention solutions, dam plans
data.description: The mayor of Yala city municipality, Pongsak Yingchoncharoen, has proposed guidelines to address long-term flood issues while revisiting long-standing proposals to construct the Krong Pinang and Kuemeng dams as part of flood prevention efforts.

data.title: Moroccan sought in Chiang Mai killing
data.description: Thai police have sought help from Interpol to arrest a  Moroccan  man suspected of murdering his girlfriend in Chiang Mai and fleeing the country.

data.title: Second cash handout ‘by end of February’
data.description: The second phase of the government’s 10,000-baht cash  handout  is expected in February, government spokesman Jirayu Houngsub assured on Saturday.

data.title: More media coverage of Mekong region urged
data.description: LHASA - Media outlets in six Greater Mekong Sub-Region (GMS) countries are being urged to help report stories about Lancang-Mekong nations to foster cooperation in the area.

data.title: Couple arrested for duping job seekers
data.description: Police have arrested a couple who allegedly duped job seekers into paying them 70,000 baht each to arrange  jobs overseas  but provided them with nothing but  fake documents .

data.title: American tourist electrocuted in Phuket
data.description: An American tourist was killed when he slipped on a wet sidewalk and was  electrocuted  by a faulty streetlight in  Phuket , authorities said on Friday.

data.title: 'No progress made' by Joint Technical Committee on Cambodia
data.description: The government has admitted that the establishment of a Joint Technical Committee (JTC) to negotiate with Cambodia on disputed maritime areas has not made any progress and is still in the process of being formed, according to Deputy Prime Minister Phumtham Wechayachai.

data.title: Thai crew members not yet released by Myanmar
data.description: Myanmar authorities have yet to release four Thai crew members, citing the need to follow proper procedures.

data.title: A charter change muddle
data.description: A charter change muddle

data.title: B7bn budget urged to stop farmers burning sugarcane
data.description: To curb PM2.5 pollution levels, the government has been urged to allocate a 7-billion-baht budget to encourage sugarcane farmers to harvest their crops while they are fresh rather than burn them.

data.title: Pheu Thai bill 'to curb coups'
data.description: The Pheu Thai Party has proposed a bill to amend the Defence Ministry Administration Act, which would reduce the military

data.title: 'No progress made' by JTC on Cambodia
data.description: The government has admitted that the establishment of a Joint Technical Committee (JTC) to negotiate with Cambodia on disputed maritime areas has not made any progress and is still in the process of being formed, according to Deputy Prime Minister Phumtham Wechayachai.

data.title: 'No special treatment' for Yingluck
data.description: The Ministry of Justice has denied that a rule allowing prisoners to be released on parole and detained in their houses was made for the benefit of any individual, especially former prime minister Yingluck Shinawatra.

data.title: Myanmar releases 4 Thai crew
data.description: The government will request the return of a confiscated Thai fishing boat following the release of four Thai crew members by Myanmar authorities yesterday, according to Defence Minister Phumtham Wechayachai.

data.title: Three former MPs to be paroled on Sunday
data.description: Three former  Bhumjaithai  Party MPs imprisoned for ethical violations will be released on  parole  on Sunday, according to the Department of Corrections.

data.title: Return of 700-year-old bronze statue welcomed
data.description: The Ministry of Culture on Friday held a ceremony to hand over Phra Chao Tong, a 700-year-old bronze  Buddha statue  stolen from Wat Sri Ping Muang in October 1988, to  Phayao  province.

data.title: 7 officers in trouble after violent arrest
data.description: The Metropolitan Police Bureau (MPB) has vowed that justice will prevail in a physical  assault  case involving seven traffic police officers and the son of a retired policeman in Bangkok on Wednesday night.

data.title: Thailand on alert for ‘Disease X’
data.description: The Ministry of Public Health has alerted all its offices to be vigilant about an  infectious disease  outbreak in the Democratic Republic of  Congo  that has sickened hundreds of people and has killed at least 79 since late October.

data.title: Celebrity 'Film' reports to police over alleged B20m extortion
data.description: Actor-cum-singer Rattapoom "Film" Tokongsup turned himself in to the Crime Suppression Division (CSD) on Friday to answer charges of alleged extortion related to The iCon Group fraud case and defaming a popular television show host.

data.title: Chinese driver hits multiple vehicles, killing one in Pattaya
data.description: PATTAYA - A 39-year-old Chinese man crashed his Toyota Alphard into multiple vehicles, killing one and injuring four others on Thursday night.

data.title: Speeding van crashes, kills one in Pattaya
data.description: PATTAYA - A 39-year-old Chinese man crashed his Toyota Alphard into multiple vehicles, killing one and injuring four others on Thursday night.

data.title: Cold spell returns to Thailand, temperature drops expected
data.description: Temperatures in Thailand are expected to drop slightly in the coming days as cold weather returns to the country, the Meteorological Department reported on Friday.

data.title: Health advocates denounce e-cigarette legalisation plans
data.description: Scholars and health experts have voiced their opposition to the House special committee on e-cigarettes

data.title: Ministry pauses Rama II roadworks
data.description: The Transport Ministry has ordered the suspension of all construction projects along Rama II Road from Dec 26 to Jan 2 to facilitate travel during the New Year holiday.

data.title: HM Queen to compete
data.description: Her Majesty the Queen will join Thailand

data.title: Anti-graft agency to probe officials' role in land misuse
data.description: The National Anti-Corruption Commission (NACC) is preparing to investigate whether any state officials were engaged in alleged land encroachment in Saraburi.

data.title: Floods yet to recede in five provinces
data.description: Floodwaters have begun to recede in some areas in the South, but inundation was still reported in five provinces in the flood-hit region yesterday, Sasikarn Wattanachan, deputy spokeswoman of the Prime Minister

data.title: Former editor dies at 61
data.description: Former Bangkok Post sports editor Wanchai Rujawongsanti passed away on Wednesday morning after a long battle with lung cancer. He was 61.

data.title: Sia Piang out of jail, dept confirms
data.description: The Department of Corrections (DoC) has confirmed the release of Apichart Jansakulporn, better known as Sia Piang, a businessman sentenced to 48 years in prison for his involvement in the rice-pledging scandal.

data.title: Rewrite 'unlikely' under current govt
data.description: A mandatory "cooling off" period will likely apply before the move to amend the referendum bill resumes, meaning a charter rewrite will not be finished within the tenure of the current government, according to Nikorn Chamnong, secretary of the Senate-MP joint committee.

data.title: Climate chief maps plan to tap new fund
data.description: Thailand needs more efforts to access financial aid to fight climate change, according to the chief of the Department of Climate Change and Environment.
